page.title: 09CHELTENHAM RAILWAY SYSTEM
page.content: { Coal depot}employing 130 people (13 part time) receives 2{trains}of 40 wagons weekly; 70 tonnes per wagon, therefore 7000 tonnes delivered. An- thracite (mainly from S.Wales, but some imported) and bituminous coal from S Africa,W.Germany and Russia are 2 main kinds out of 30 types of coal stored at depot.Coal goes to all parts of England. The{Railway}is a link between Glou- cester and the North. Passengers wishing to travel to London go to Gloucester first, then to Swindon, where they change to Inter-City trains for the Capital. 90 trains going South pass through this area every day, only 85 go North. Trains are varied - car, coal, freight and passenger trains pass through the level crossing at Alstone holding up local traffic. TV cameras scan the lines continuously.
